newsitem.title: FRANCE: Accor sees higher profit in budget hotel segment.
newsitem.headline: Accor sees higher profit in budget hotel segment.

text.p: Accor expects its budget hotel activities, the Ibis, Etap Hotel and Formule 1 chains grouped in the Sphere International division, to generate pre-exceptional profit of 300 million francs this year, up 25 percent, chairman Jean-Marc Espalioux said on Wednesday.
He told the annual shareholders meeting that the profit objective for Europcar, the 50-50 venture between Accor and Volkswagen, was 50 million francs for 1997.

He said he expected gross operating profit of $40 million a year in 1997-98 for Carlson-Wagonlit Travel, despite the negative $30 million impact of a "re-engineering", and pre-tax, pre-exceptional attributable profit for Carlson-Wagonlit close to that of 1996.
